verses.roman:
ei mata baṅge prabhu kare nānā līlā
ethā navadvīpe lakṣmī virahe duḥkhī hailā

synonyms: ei mata—in this way; baṅge—in East Bengal; prabhu—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; kare—does; nānā—various; līlā—pastimes; ethā—here; navadvīpe—in Navadvīpa; lakṣmī—the wife of Nimāi Paṇḍita; virahe—in separation; duḥkhī—unhappy; hailā—became.
translation: Because the Lord was engaged in various ways in preaching work in East Bengal, His wife, Lakṣmīdevī, was very unhappy at home in separation from her husband.
